strats.name: Leave with Runway
strats.devNote: With Phantoon defeated, entering from the opposite door will have the conveyors on and shortening the runway.

strats.name: Leave with Runway, Conveyor Assist
devNote: With Phantoon defeated, entering from the same door will have the conveyors on and lengthening the runway.
Without Phantoon defeated, the runway is still 45+ tiles.

strats.name: Transition with Stored Fall Speed (more speed)
Transition with Stored Fall Speed (more speed)
Leave with Runway
strats.devNote: With Phantoon defeated, entering from the opposite door will have the conveyors on and shortening the runway.

strats.name: Leave with Runway, Conveyor Assist
devNote: With Phantoon defeated, entering from the same door will have the conveyors on and lengthening the runway.
Without Phantoon defeated, the runway is still 45+ tiles.

strats.name: Covern or Atomic Ice Clip Door Lock Skip
note: Freeze an Atomic at a precise distance below the door in order to crouch-jump up and clip through the door shell.
The pixel window is larger and higher with Morph and an X-Ray stand-up, in which case a standing jump is used.
If Phantoon is not defeated, stand on the stairs so that Samus is just a few pixels lower, then freeze the Covern low in its cycle.
Alternatively, freeze it high then perform a tight down grab to get onto it for a pixel perfect clip.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Frozen Atomic
note: Bring two atomics to the top of the room.
Stand on one frozen Atomic to bring a second Atomic to the correct height to use as a crouch platform.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Atomic
strats.note: Position and freeze an Atomic to extend the runway. Maintain a half-tile gap between the runway to extend it as far as possible.
strats.devNote: It could be possible to freeze a Covern in its place, but it seems very difficult to position.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Covern or Atomic
Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark
G-mode Morph Overload PLMs
strats.note: Use the camera scroll blocks just left of the bomb blocks, in order to overload PLMs and go through them.

strats.name: G-mode Overload PLMs
note: Use the camera scroll blocks just right of the bomb blocks, in order to overload PLMs and go through them.
Cancel g-mode, morph and move back towards the bomb blocks in order to fix the camera.

strats.name: G-mode Morph to Missiles While Blind
note: Use the camera scroll blocks just right of the bomb blocks, in order to overload PLMs and go through them.
Exit g-mode and travel to the item and back while off screen.

strats.name: Leave with Runway
strats.devNote: FIXME: It may be possible to extend this runway with a frozen Atomic or Covern.

strats.name: Leave with Runway, Broken Blocks
strats.devNote: It is technically possible to reset at 7 and keep the top layer of obstacle B intact by clipping through the blocks

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Covern or Atomic
Temporary Blue Bounce
strats.devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Bounce (In-Room)
strats.devNote: There is 0.5 unusable tiles in this runway.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs
strats.note: Use the camera scroll blocks just left of the bomb blocks, in order to overload PLMs and go through them.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: From this direction, the shot blocks are fully breakable with Power Beam

strats.name: Stored Moonfall Clip
note: Moonfall twice, on the right or left side of the shot blocks.
This will put Samus inside of shotblocks, which can be cleared by shooting.
If on the left side, perform two more moonfalls.
The camera will be misaligned after the door transition.

strats.name: Atomic Ice Moonfall Door Lock Skip
note: Lure two Atomics down to the bottom of the room, and freeze them to be able to moonfall between them and aim down.
After gaining enough speed, press forward to fall down and clip past the door shell below.
Falling with too much speed can cause Samus to go out of bounds.

strats.name: Power Bombs
note: It is possible to use a single Power Bomb to break the bomb blocks going left to the item, right to the door, and shot blocks going down.
Place the power bomb against the right wall at the top of the stairs between the three obstacles.

strats.name: Temporary Blue (In-Room)
note: Shinecharging up the stairs gives a longer effective runway than shinecharging down them.
A frozen Atomic (or Covern) can be used for more runway.
strats.devNote: There is 1/2 a unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: G-mode Overload PLMs
note: Use the camera scroll blocks just right of the bomb blocks, in order to overload PLMs and go through them.
Cancel g-mode, morph and move back towards the bomb blocks in order to fix the camera.

strats.name: G-mode Morph to Item While Blind
note: Use the camera scroll blocks just right of the bomb blocks, in order to overload PLMs and go through them.
Exit g-mode and travel to the item and back while off screen.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Full Runway)
Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Short Runway)
Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark
Leave With Runway - Frozen Atomic or Covern
note: Lure an Atomic or get a Covern to spawn to slightly extend the runway.
Positioning a Covern is a bit tricky. Consecutive wall jump or Space Jump in place above the gap but not quite at the ceiling,
or perform full height jumps to sometimes get the Covern to spawn in position. A crouch shot may help freeze the Coven when it is in position.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Covern or Atomic
G-mode Morph Overload PLMs
strats.note: Use the camera scroll blocks just left of the bomb blocks, in order to overload PLMs and go through them.

strats.name: G-mode Overload PLMs
note: Use the camera scroll blocks just right of the bomb blocks, in order to overload PLMs and go through them.
Cancel g-mode, morph and move back towards the bomb blocks in order to fix the camera.

strats.name: G-mode Morph to Item While Blind
note: Use the camera scroll blocks just right of the bomb blocks, in order to overload PLMs and go through them.
Exit g-mode and travel to the item and back while off screen.

strats.name: Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark
Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark
Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 1 screen, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.
If Phantoon is not defeated then you have to move quickly to prevent the Coverns from hitting you.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Atomic or Covern
note: Lure an Atomic or get a Covern to spawn to extend the runway.
Position the enemy horizontally centered in the hole to extend the runway all the way to the wall.
Positioning a Covern is tricky. One way to set this up is with Space Jump.
Align Samus left against the tile in the ceiling to align the Covern horizontally, then perform short Space Jumps half way between
the desired Covern position and the ceiling until the Covern spawns in the correct position.
strats.devNote: FIXME: There may be other ways to set up the Covern positioning without Space Jump.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Covern or Atomic
G-mode Morph Overload PLMs
strats.note: Use the camera scroll blocks just left of the bomb blocks, in order to overload PLMs and go through them.

strats.name: Temporary Blue
strats.devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Chain (In-Room)
note: Shinecharging up the stairs gives a longer effective runway than shinecharging down them.
Bounce down the stairs to make movement simpler.
A frozen Atomic (or Covern) can be used for more runway.
strats.devNote: There is 1/2 a unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: G-mode Overload PLMs
note: Use the camera scroll blocks just right of the bomb blocks, in order to overload PLMs and go through them.
Cancel g-mode, morph and move back towards the bomb blocks in order to fix the camera.

strats.name: G-mode Morph to Item While Blind
note: Use the camera scroll blocks just right of the bomb blocks, in order to overload PLMs and go through them.
Exit g-mode and travel to the item and back while off screen.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Bounce (Come In Shinecharging)
strats.devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Bounce (Come In With Temporary Blue)
strats.devNote: A comeInWithBlueSpringBallBounce strat would also be possible, but there's so little space available that we would need to more carefully define the matching requirements.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Covern or Atomic
Blocks Already Broken
note: If Spring Ball is unavailable, then either crouch jump and morph from the stairs, or run and jump into morph from the right of the stairs.
If you have HiJump, it must be disabled.

strats.name: Shoot the Blocks
note: If Spring Ball is unavailable, then either crouch jump and morph from the stairs, or run and jump into morph from the right of the stairs.
If you have HiJump, it must be disabled.

strats.name: Power Bomb
note: Use a Power Bomb to bounce into the morph tunnel.
This will break the shot blocks and the Bomb Blocks going to the door to the right.

strats.name: Wrecked Ship Main Shaft Partial Covern Ice Clip
note: Use the Covern to partial ceiling clip so your beam can reach the shot block of the ceiling at the end of the Morph tunnel to the left.
It is possible to mid-air morph to get into the morph tunnel with nothing, from the Covern, the ground, or the stairs below.

strats.name: R-Mode Standup to Shoot the Shot Blocks
note: In R-Mode, kill the Coverns until there is Energy in Samus's Reserves. Get into the Morph tunnel and go to the far left.
Wait for Coverns to damage Samus down until Reserves trigger, forcing a stand up and enabling her to shoot the shot blocks and escape.

strats.name: Coverns and Atomics Farm (Power Off)
note: To shoot the Atomics with Ice or Plasma, crouch near the edge of the glass and shoot forward;
angled shots downwards also work but from a tile further back.
devNote: Killing the Coverns with any of these options can be done on a single cycle.
Screw Attack can kill the Coverns quickly, but can't kill the Atomics. Bombs can kill the Atimics easily, but not the Coverns.
FIXME: Should this require another tech? canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess is a pretty high-level requirement.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: Enter on the left side of the doorway to reduce the amount of energy used.
strats.devNote: This strat is not useful in-room, but can satisfy a strat in the room before with an exit shinespark.

strats.name: Shinespark (through Toilet)
strats.devNote: This strat is not useful in-room, but can satisfy a strat in the room before with an exit shinespark.

strats.name: G-Mode Regain Mobility
note: Line up with the far right or left side of doorframe in the room below, to be able to not fall back through after entry, as the door remains open.
Be careful not to fall into the door while being hit by the Covern.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Bounce (Phantoon Dead)
note: Run towards the conveyor to more easily build the ShineCharge, and for an easier bounce into the morph tunnel.
Neutral bounce into the Morph tunnel, and SpringBall bounce to continue all the way through.
strats.devNote: 16 tiles plus conveyor pushback.

strats.name: Chain Temporary Blue Bounce (Phantoon Alive)
strats.note: Neutral bounce into the Morph tunnel, and SpringBall bounce to continue all the way through.
strats.devNote: Defeating Phantoon makes this strat easier.

strats.name: Leave with Runway - Phantoon Alive
strats.devNote: The length is more similar to 5 with 0 open end, than 4 with 1.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Atomic
note: One way to position the Atomic is to lure it to the right by standing on the ground,
then jump over it and freeze it while standing in the corner on the ground once it is just under 2 tiles away from the ledge.
Stand on the ledge and freeze it again once it is in position, maintaining a half-tile gap between the Atomic and the runway to extend it as much as possible.
strats.devNote: This does not require Phantoon to be killed, as the broken workrobot is there otherwise.

strats.name: Leave Space Jumping
strats.devNote: FIXME: Slightly longer runway can be used with power on; it's not clear yet if there's any application where this matters.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Atomic
G-mode Morph
strats.note: Use the camera scroll blocks just left of the bomb blocks, in order to overload PLMs and go through them.

strats.name: Basement G-mode Morph Workrobot Ride
note: On room entry, place a Power Bomb to kill the Atomic and land on the Workrobot.
Wait for the Workrobot to move across the room until it meets with a second robot.
Depending on where the robots meet, either roll off and quickly roll under the Atomic,
stay on for a second to try to lure the Atomic left a bit, or use a Power Bomb to kill it.
Be careful not to hit any of the invisible, stationary lasers,
and don't place any Power Bombs too close to the right wall or it will hit the bomb block and it will no longer be passable.
Quickly use the camera scroll blocks just left of the bomb blocks, in order to overload PLMs and go through them before the Atomic hits Samus.

strats.name: Atomic Ice Clip Door Lock Skip
note: Freeze an Atomic at a precise distance below the door in order to jump up and clip through the door shell.
The pixel window is larger and higher with Morph and an X-Ray stand-up.

strats.name: Leave With Temporary Blue (Facing Right)
strats.devNote: A couple more tiles can be used if power is on, but this doesn't seem worth modeling.

strats.name: Leave With Platform Below
strats.devNote: We could add another jumpway (or two) for the long platform below but it does not yet seem to have an application.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Frozen Atomic
note: Stand on one frozen Atomic to bring a second Atomic to the correct height to use as a crouch platform.

strats.name: Carry G-Mode Morph Back Up
strats.note: With Bombs, it may be helpful to roll off the platform and kill the Atomics before safely leaving the room.

strats.name: Basement Speedball (Phantoon Dead)
note: This speedball is easier with Phantoon dead, since you can push the robots all the way left.
It's even possible to setup the short hop mockball by bonking the center platform.

strats.name: Basement Speedball (Phantoon Alive)
strats.note: This speedball is harder with Phantoon alive and has a shorter runway because of the robot standing in the way.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce
strats.devNote: Higher run speed can be used, especially if power is on, but it is more difficult and not clear yet if it's worth modeling.

strats.name: G-mode Morph
strats.note: Use the camera scroll blocks just left of the bomb blocks, in order to overload PLMs and go through them.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Power Bombs, Wait for the Workrobot
note: On room entry, dodge the atomic and quickly place a Power Bomb to kill both Atomics.
It is tricky but possible to kill them both with a single Power Bomb placed on the right half of the platform.
Wait for the Workrobot to pass, then roll off to the right of it. Be careful not to hit any of the invisible, stationary lasers.
Use the camera scroll blocks just left of the bomb blocks, in order to overload PLMs and go through them.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Spring Ball Bounce (Come in Shinecharging)
Temporary Blue Spring Ball Bounce (Come in With Temporary Blue)
G-mode
strats.note: Use the camera scroll blocks just right of the bomb blocks, in order to overload PLMs and go through them. Cancel g-mode and return into the morph tunnel to fix the camera.

strats.name: G-mode Morph While Blind
strats.note: Use the camera scroll blocks just right of the bomb blocks, in order to overload PLMs and go through them. Dodge the enemies while getting to the door.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Atomic
note: Lure an Atomic from the left half of the room. Morph in the corner against the top stair and wait for the Atomic to approach.
Quickly unmorph just before and freeze the Atomic just after it hits Samus.

strats.name: Crystal Flash
strats.devNote: The Gadora won't attack if you position all the way to the left.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Atomic, Lured from the Left
Leave With Runway - Frozen Covern
strats.note: Stand a few pixels away from the bottom of the stairs to easily position the Covern and extend the runway as far as possible.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Covern
G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Phantoon
devNote: Not likely to be possible, as it requires canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess and Phantoon alive with the door unlocked.

strats.name: G-Mode Regain Mobility
strats.note: Only works when Phantoon opens his eye while on the far left side.
strats.devNote: This would only be useful to leave in g-mode.

strats.name: Leave With Mockball
strats.note: If the power is on, time the jump for when the electricity is inactive.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce
strats.note: If the power is on, time the jump for when the electricity is inactive.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Atomic
note: Freeze the Atomic in position to extend the runway. Maintain a half-tile gap between the Atomic and the runway to extend it as far as possible.
One easy method to align the Atomic is to lure the it high then stand under it to freeze it.
strats.devNote: This should be possible with a frozen Covern, but it is annoying to set up.

strats.name: Leave Spinning (Space Jump, Power On)
strats.note: With the power on, blue speed can be used to pass through the atomic cage on the floor while continuing to gain speed.

strats.name: Leave With Mockball (Space Jump, Power On)
Leave With Tricky Spring Ball Bounce
Leave With Tricky Spring Ball Bounce (Power On)
Atomics and Coverns Farm (Power Off)
devNote: With Plasma or Wave, there is no canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess, because a comparable farm is also available with power on.

strats.name: Crystal Flash
strats.note: If the leftmost Kihunter is still alive, lay the Power Bomb with it on screen, to kill it before the Crystal Flash refill begins.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Covern, Atomic, or Kihunter
G-Mode Regain Mobility
strats.devNote: The Covern will do more damage than the Atomic, so there is no canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess.

strats.name: Atomic Ice Moonfall Door Lock Skip
note: Clear out the Kihunters near the door, and freeze two Atomics to set up a moonfall between them, and aim down.
After gaining enough speed, press forward to fall down and clip past the door shell below.
Falling with too much speed can cause Samus to go out of bounds.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.devNote: This strat is not useful in-room, but can satisfy a strat in the room before with an exit shinespark.

strats.name: G-Mode Regain Mobility
strats.note: Use a Covern or Kihunter. A flying Kihunter takes about 25 seconds to get to the door.
strats.devNote: The Kihunter will do more damage than the Covern, so whether Phantoon is dead or not, that strat will be accurate or conservative.

strats.name: Leave With Mockball
devNote: A couple extra tiles could be used by taking a hit and using i-frames from the atomic cage on the floor, if Phantoon is defeated;
with a 12-tile shortcharge to gain invulnerability from blue speed, even more runway could be used.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Covern, Atomic, or Kihunter
G-Mode Regain Mobility
strats.note: Use a Covern or Kihunter. A flying Kihunter will collide with Samus eventually, which could take up to 30 seconds, based on her positioning.
strats.devNote: The Kihunter will do more damage than the Covern, so whether Phantoon is dead or not, that strat will be accurate or conservative.

strats.name: Leave with Runway, Break Speed Blocks
Leave with Runway, Enter with Speed
Leave with Runway (Enter with Shinespark to Break the Blocks)
Bowling Alley Speed Block Moondance (Leave with Stored Fall Speed)
note: Use SpeedBooster to construct a structure for Moondancing that has 1 chest height block and 1 head height block to the right of it and no other Speed blocks.
Crystal Flash below the lower block, exactly pixel aligned with its right side, to standup and then begin Moondancing.
After Samus sinks through the bottom tile, it is possible to use Grapple to return to a crouch and wiggle right and then Turn-Around Aim Cancel to escape to the right.
Without Grapple, count to 174 Moonfalls and delicately Moonfall so as to remain crouched and then wiggle to the right.
Finally, shortcharge to break the remaining Speed blocks and reach the door.

strats.name: Bowling Alley Speed Block Moondance (Leave with More Stored Fall Speed)
note: Use SpeedBooster to construct a structure for Moondancing that has 1 chest height block and 1 head height block to the right of it and no other Speed blocks.
Crystal Flash below the lower block, exactly pixel aligned with its right side, to standup and then begin Moondancing.
After Samus sinks through the floor tiles, use Grapple to return to a standing position and count an additional 145 moonfalls.
Then use Grapple to return to a crouch and wiggle right and Turn-Around Aim Cancel to escape to the right.
Finally, shortcharge to break the remaining Speed blocks and reach the door.

strats.name: Bowling Alley Speed Block Moondance (Moonfall Clip)
note: Use SpeedBooster to construct a structure for Moondancing that has 1 chest height block and 1 head height block to the right of it and no other Speed blocks.
Crystal Flash below the lower block, exactly pixel aligned with its right side, to standup and then begin Moondancing.
After Samus sinks through the bottom tile, it is possible to use Grapple to return to a crouch and wiggle right and then Turn-Around Aim Cancel to escape to the right.
Without Grapple, count to 174 Moonfalls and delicately Moonfall so as to remain crouched and then wiggle to the right.
The Camera will not follow Samus after clipping.

strats.name: Stored Moonfall Clip
strats.note: The camera will not follow Samus after clipping.

strats.name: Leave Shinecharged (X-Mode or Phantoon Alive)
strats.devNote: Three spike hits are expected per attempt (with any additional leniency hits being multiplied by this amount).

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Power Off)
Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Space Jump)
SpringFling Bowling
note: Start with Springball disabled.  Jump over the spikes and midair morph.
SpringFling on the way down, SpringBall bounce through the spikes, then SpringFling again to reach the statue taking only one spike hit.

strats.name: 2-hit Bowling
strats.note: This is doable even without any momentum from a previous room, but pretty tight.

strats.name: 2-hit Speed Bowling
strats.note: A bit easier than 2-hit bowling

strats.name: X-Mode
strats.note: Move in X-Mode until the Chozo Statue becomes visible and then jump before releasing XRay.

strats.name: Bowling Alley Ceiling Bomb Jump
strats.note: This is a very long ceiling bomb jump.

strats.name: Bowling Alley X-Ray Climb
note: Climb up about half a screen.
If Phantoon is dead, the last part of the climb should be done carefully to avoid triggering collision with the spikes:
Do not press forward or turn-around except while X-Ray is active.
For each X-ray stand-up, release the turn-around input quickly to make sure that it is not still held after X-Ray deactivates.
Once Samus is high enough, unequip X-Ray, jump up (from either standing or crouch) to clip past the spikes, and land, taking a single spike hit.
Then use the i-frames from the spike hit to run and jump to the left to make it to the door.
Samus is high enough after the top of her arm cannon first becomes visible at the bottom of the screen; or up to 3 additional climbs can be performed after that point.
In case of an accidental spike collision, it is possible to recover:
Unless Samus climbed higher than needed, she will still be stuck in the wall, will take a single spike hit, and be able to continue climbing.
With Grapple it is possible to swing on the Grapple blocks, avoiding all spike damage.
Spike damage can also be avoided with Space Jump, by doing a stationary turn-around spin jump, which is very precise.
devNote: FIXME: The canBeVeryPatient is for difficulty placement, as the damageless Space Jump version would likely require many attempts.
The resourceCapacity requirement is to ensure that reserve energy management will not be needed for the lower-difficulty version of the strat;
this could be refined since suits can affect spike damage, but we don't yet have a good way to represent that cleanly, given that randomizers are likely to modify suit damage protection.

strats.name: Bomb the blocks
strats.note: If using PBs, place it far enough right to reach the shot blocks.

strats.name: Long Beam and Screw
strats.note: Plasma or Charged Spazer can reach the shot blocks through the tunnel while crouched.
devNote: Plasma is somewhat known as a way to reach the blocks.
Charge+Spazer is not, and to shoot around the Bowling Chozo you would add Wave to make things more complicated.
If we're requiring strat knowledge here, camera unlock is more generally applicable.
A very precise wave shot from the stairs can also work but is much harder and less obvious than the camera unlock strat.

strats.name: Bowling Alley Missile Chozo Camera Unlock
note: Break the shot blocks with Power Beam by first rolling into the morph tunnel to unlock camera scroll for this room.
The blocks can now be cleared from the left side by shooting and quickly scrolling the camera to the right a small amount.
A shot from crouch will reach the bottom block by following the shot as a ball, or wave beam works from the stairs.
Screw Attack is still needed to clear the bomb blocks.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: The bomb block respawns. It must be broken on the way back too.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Bounce and SpringBall
note: Use Temporary Blue to bounce into the Morph Tunnel with temp blue then continue to the bomb block using SpringBall.
Just left of center of the pit is a good place to bounce for entering the tunnel.
Requires either a tight shortcharge or clearing the power bomb blocks to open up more runway.
devNote: Killing phantoon only removes requirements for the strat.
The runway is a bit longer with Phantoon killed and the Power Bomb blocks broken, but it shouldn't matter at this difficulty.

strats.name: Blind Traversal
note: The shot blocks must be broken using Bombs or Power Bombs because Beams will instantly despawn.
Use X-Ray or a Crystal Flash to stand up, followed by a Partial Floor clip to jump through the Crumble blocks.

strats.name: Crystal Flash Grapple Clip
strats.note: Menu to Grappling Beam before the crystal flash ends and mash shoot while holding down.

strats.name: Damage Down then Crystal Flash Grapple Clip
note: Fall through the Crumble blocks in order to damage down using either the spikes or repeated Shinesparks.
Touching the Chozo statue will lock the camera in a less useful position.
Menu to Grappling Beam before the crystal flash ends and mash shoot while holding down.
devNote: FIXME: If power is on, spikes or worker robots can damage Samus.
but multiples of 60 may not put Samus into Crystal Flash range, and visiting the robots will lock the camera making the jump-into-CF much harder.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged
strats.devNote: FIXME: Requires the item to have been collected.

strats.name: Carry Shinecharge
strats.devNote: FIXME: Requires the item to have been collected.

strats.name: Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark
strats.devNote: FIXME: Requires the item to have been collected.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Transition with Stored Fall Speed (more speed)
Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged
strats.devNote: FIXME: Requires the item to have been collected.

strats.name: Carry Shinecharge
strats.devNote: FIXME: Requires the item to have been collected.

strats.name: Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark
strats.devNote: FIXME: Requires the item to have been collected.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Transition with Stored Fall Speed (more speed)
Leave with Runway
devNote: Note that this room has a half-width runway tile.
It is possible to extend this runway with a Covern with canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess, but it is very difficult to position the Covern.
The Covern can easily be positioned 2 pixels above the runway with Morph, but that can't be used to extend short shinecharge strats.

strats.name: Leave Spinning
note: The effective runway length is shortened due to the conveyor moving in the same direction as Samus.
If needing the highest possible speed, run on the conveyor furthest from the door.

strats.name: Leave Spinning (Power Off)
note: If needing the highest possible speed, run on the conveyor furthest from the door.

strats.name: Leave With Mockball
strats.note: Run on the conveyor closest to the door; its effective length is shortened due to moving in the same direction as Samus.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce
strats.note: Run on the conveyor closest to the door; its effective length is shortened due to moving in the same direction as Samus.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Power Off)
Leave Space Jumping
note: The effective runway length is shortened due to the conveyor moving in the same direction as Samus.
If needing the highest possible speed, use the conveyor furthest from the door.

strats.name: Leave With Temporary Blue (Power On)
note: Shortcharge by running right on the conveyor closest to the door, gain blue speed, and jump onto the platform to the right with temporary blue.
Then use X-ray to turn and ride the conveyor back to the left and reach the door.

strats.name: Crystal Flash
strats.devNote: The Bull and Workrobot projectiles aren't a problem.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Covern or Bull
G-Mode Regain Mobility
strats.devNote: The Covern will do more damage than the Bull, so there is no canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess.

strats.name: Coverns and Atomics Farm (Power Off)
note: It is possible to kill the trapped Atomics with any beam upgrade besides charge.
Kill the atomics while waiting for the Coverns to respawn.
devNote: Killing the Coverns with any of these options can be done on a single cycle. Screw Attack can kill the Coverns quickly, but can't kill the Atomics.
FIXME: Should this require another tech? canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess is a pretty high-level requirement.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: By normal means, the path can't be passed unless the Workrobot is activated (so Phantoon dead)

strats.name: Blue Speed Jump
note: Run on the conveyor to build Speed for breaking the bomb block.
Push the right side Worker Robot onto the conveyor
Jump low into the wall so Samus' head touches the block.
Speed can be used to clear the Bulls.
strats.devNote: Spacejumping from left conveyor feels a little harder.

strats.name: WS East Supers Robot Clip (Left to Right)
note: Kago through the Workrobot by jumping, pressing down, then morphing and moving right just before hitting the robot.
The bomb blocks can be broken with a bomb, Power Bomb, or using Screw Attack.
If using bombs, be careful when breaking the bottom bomb block - if morphed, you will be pushed into it and stuck.
To do this, place a bomb at the bottom, then a bomb at the peak boost height and unmorph before landing. Alternatively use a short jump morph.
If the morph tunnel is open, kagoing through the robot will force Samus into it.
devNote: If Phantoon is alive, 'Base' can be used instead.
Note that this strat is useless in vanilla, as the item only spawns if Phantoon has been killed.

strats.name: WS East Supers Robot Clip Run-In-Place
note: Kago into the worker robot and start running away from the wall until the bomb blocks are broken with SpeedBooster.
The short charge taps are extremely precise because gaining too much run speed and Samus will exit the robot.
devNote: If Phantoon is dead, 'Blue Speed Jump' can be used instead.
Note that this strat is useless in vanilla, as the item only spawns if Phantoon has been killed.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: By normal means, the path can't be passed unless the Workrobot is activated (so Phantoon dead)
strats.devNote: This doesn't require breaking the bomb blocks on the premise that you can't get here without breaking them.

strats.name: WS East Supers Crystal Flash Clip (Right to Left)
note: Crystal flash to force a standup then spin jump up then morph to bypass the dead robot. Use Coverns to damage down if necessary.
Note that if the Covern spawns on Samus while crystal flashing, it will deal large amounts of damage.
To avoid this, it is recommended to kill the Covern and leave its drop, then quickly get in the morph tunnel and CF.
devNote: If Phantoon is alive, 'Base' can be used instead.
Note that this strat is useless in vanilla, as the item only spawns if Phantoon has been killed.

strats.name: WS East Supers R-Mode Standup Clip (Right to Left)
note: In R-Mode, kill the Coverns until there is Energy in Samus's Reserves. Get into the Morph tunnel and go to the far left.
Wait for Coverns to damage Samus down until Reserves trigger, forcing a stand up and enabling her to escape.
Note that it is required to break the bomb block above the Morph tunnel as well, in order to clip out.
devNote: If Phantoon is alive, 'Base' can be used instead.
Note that this strat is useless in vanilla, as the item only spawns if Phantoon has been killed.

strats.name: Suitless Water Shinecharge, Leave Shinesparking (Bottom)
strats.note: Start at least 2 tiles from the water line, and stutter just before entering the water in order to charge a spark in room.

strats.name: Suitless Water Shinecharge, Leave Shinesparking
strats.note: Start at least 2 tiles from the water line, and stutter just before entering the water in order to charge a spark in room.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Bull
Sponge Bath Bull Boost
strats.note: Position the Bull with beam shots before jumping into it.

strats.name: Shinespark, Come in Charging, Water Shinecharge
strats.devNote: The 17 submerged tiles behave as 7 tiles with high run speed. The 3 steep down tiles behave as approximately 1.

strats.name: Exterior Speedjump
strats.note: Requires at least 3 tiles to work, but some longer lengths don't work.

strats.name: Cross-Room Wall-Jumpless Tricky Dash Jump
note: Requires a very precise runway length in the previous room of 15 tiles with no open end.
Jump while under or to the right of the Bull.
Samus's speed no longer changes once hitting the water, so the jump is very forgiving, while the runway length is not.

strats.name: Sponge Bath In-Room Speedjump
strats.note: It doesn't work from flush against the door. Start moving about half a tile away from it.

strats.name: Ceiling Bomb Jump
strats.devNote: It is possible with a low vertical diagonal bomb jump, or a double HBJ, but those aren't tech yet.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Ceiling Bomb Jump
strats.note: Kill the Bull with bombs, by switching between the high and low ground. Rapidly place bombs while rolling slowly.
strats.devNote: It is possible with a low vertical diagonal bomb jump, or a double HBJ, but those aren't tech yet.

strats.name: Suitless Water Shinecharge
strats.note: Start at least 2 tiles from the water line, and stutter just before entering the water in order to charge a spark in room.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Gravity or Phantoon Alive)
devNote: One runway tile is considered unusable, in order to allow a quick jump up without needing to turn around.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (HiJump Wall Jump)
devNote: The 17 submerged tiles behave as 7 tiles with high run speed. The 3 steep down tiles behave as approximately 1.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave with Spark (Space Jump)
strats.note: If needed, shoot the Bull to prevent it from blocking Samus' path.

strats.name: Suitless Water Shinecharge, Leave Shinecharged (SpaceJump)
strats.note: Start at least 2 tiles from the water line, and stutter just before entering the water in order to charge a spark in room.

strats.name: Suitless Water Shinecharge, Leave Shinecharged (HiJump)
strats.note: Start at least 2 tiles from the water line, and stutter just before entering the water in order to charge a spark in room.

strats.name: Leave With Mockball
strats.devNote: Longer landing runway could be used but would be difficult at high run speeds.

strats.name: Leave With Mockball (Open Door)
strats.devNote: Longer landing runway could be used but would be difficult at high run speeds.

strats.name: Leave With Temporary Blue (Gravity or Power Off)
Leave With Temporary Blue (Stutter Shinecharge Spring Ball Jump)
note: If possible (and applicable), kill the Bull ahead of time, and do a shinecharge to gain temporary blue.
Otherwise, shoot the Bull to get it out of the way;
then, after getting blue speed with a stutter water shinecharge, jump directly into a spring ball jump rather than shinecharging first.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Gravity)
note: To maximize frames remaining, gain a shinecharge while sliding off the ledge into the water.

strats.name: Carry Shinecharge (Gravity)
note: Enter the room with a shinecharge.
Run and jump over the Bull (if power is on), and carry the shinecharge into the next room.

strats.name: Carry Shinecharge (SpaceJump)
note: Enter the room with a shinecharge.
Use Space Jump to run and jump over the Bull and water (if power is on), and carry the shinecharge into the next room.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave with Spark
note: Enter the room with a shinecharge.
Run and jump over the Bull (if power is on).
Fire a shot mid-air, and activate the shinespark wind-up.
Wait to spark until the shot as reached the door.

strats.name: Hero Shot Spark
note: Enter the room with a shinecharge.
Run and jump off the ledge.
Fire a shot mid-air and activate the shinespark wind-up.
Take a hit from the the Bull (if power is on).
Wait until the shot is at a specific position before sparking.
Sparking too late will cause the shot to despawn before reaching the door.
Sparking too early will cause Samus to bonk the door as it will not yet be open.
A beam shot, Missile, or Super can be used.

strats.name: Come in Getting Blue Speed, Leave With Temporary Blue
note: Jump at the end of the runway to kill the Bull with blue speed, or jump over it.
Then gain a speedball to approach the door with temporary blue.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Bull
Leave Shinecharged, X-Mode
strats.note: Jumping from the door and bouncing on the platform enemy works pretty well.
strats.devNote: Two spike hits are expected per attempt (with any additional leniency hits being multiplied by this amount).

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Power Off)
Hero Shot Shinespark
note: Land on the first spike platform, and use it to run and jump far enough through the room to trigger the fourth spike platform to fall.
Fire a shot mid-air and activate the shinespark wind-up.
Wait until the shot is at a specific position before sparking.
Sparking too late will cause the shot to despawn before reaching the door.
Sparking too early will cause Samus to bonk the door as it will not yet be open.
A beam shot, Missile, or Super can be used.

strats.name: Hero Shot Shinespark (Power Off)
note: Land on the floor, then jump and fire a shot mid-air and activate the shinespark wind-up.
Wait until the shot is at a specific position before sparking.
Sparking too late will cause the shot to despawn before reaching the door.
Sparking too early will cause Samus to bonk the door as it will not yet be open.
A beam shot, Missile, or Super can be used.

strats.name: Leave With Shinespark (Power Off, Fast Movement)
Naked Spiky Death Room (Left to Right)
Passage With Assist
strats.devNote: The room is considerably more forgiving with Morph, Gravity, or Space Jump so this is there as an alternate strat.

strats.name: Leave With Mockball
note: Enter the room from the left to get the Kzans onto the correct cycle.
Jump onto the Kzan second closest to the right door as it descends.
Position on its left side, then run and jump immediately after Samus crosses above the water line, mockballing onto the door frame ledge.
strats.devNote: Entering from the left is not technically required, but it is more tricky otherwise.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce
note: Enter the room from the left to get the Kzans onto the correct cycle.
Jump onto the Kzan second closest to the right door as it descends.
Position on its left side, then run and jump immediately after Samus crosses above the water line, bouncing on the door frame ledge.
strats.devNote: Entering from the left is not technically required, but it is more tricky otherwise.

strats.name: Leave Space Jumping
note: Enter the room from the left to get the Kzans onto the correct cycle.
Jump onto the Kzan second closest to the right door as it descends.
Position on its left side, then run and jump immediately after Samus crosses above the water line, bouncing on the door frame ledge.
strats.devNote: Entering from the left is not technically required, but it is more tricky otherwise.

strats.name: Naked Spiky Death Room (Right to Left)
Passage With Assist
strats.devNote: The room is considerably more forgiving with Morph, Gravity, or Space Jump so this is there as an alternate strat.

strats.name: Hero Shot Shinespark
note: Wait for the first spike platform to fall, jump onto it, and use it to run and jump far enough through the room to trigger the fourth spike platform to fall.
Fire a shot mid-air and activate the shinespark wind-up.
Wait until the shot is at a specific position before sparking.
Sparking too late will cause the shot to despawn before reaching the door.
Sparking too early will cause Samus to bonk the door as it will not yet be open.
A beam shot, Missile, or Super can be used.

strats.name: Hero Shot Shinespark (Power Off)
note: Land on the floor, then jump and fire a shot mid-air and activate the shinespark wind-up.
Wait until the shot is at a specific position before sparking.
Sparking too late will cause the shot to despawn before reaching the door.
Sparking too early will cause Samus to bonk the door as it will not yet be open.
A beam shot, Missile, or Super can be used.

strats.name: Leave With Shinespark (Power Off, Fast Movement)
Leave With Mockball
note: Enter the room from the right to get the Kzans onto the correct cycle.
Jump onto the Kzan second closest to the left door as it descends.
Position on its right side, then run and jump immediately after Samus crosses above the water line, mockballing onto the door frame ledge.
strats.devNote: Entering from the right is not technically required, but it is more tricky otherwise.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce
note: Enter the room from the right to get the Kzans onto the correct cycle.
Jump onto the Kzan second closest to the left door as it descends.
Position on its right side, then run and jump immediately after Samus crosses above the water line, bouncing on the door frame ledge.
strats.devNote: Entering from the right is not technically required, but it is more tricky otherwise.

strats.name: Leave Space Jumping
note: Enter the room from the right to get the Kzans onto the correct cycle.
Jump onto the Kzan second closest to the left door as it descends.
Position on its right side, then run and jump immediately after Samus crosses above the water line, bouncing on the door frame ledge.
strats.devNote: Entering from the right is not technically required, but it is more tricky otherwise.

strats.name: Leave Shinecharged, X-Mode
strats.note: Jumping from the door and bouncing on the platform enemy works pretty well.
strats.devNote: Two spike hits are expected per attempt (with any additional leniency hits being multiplied by this amount).

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Power Off)
Leave with Runway
strats.devNote: This runway can be extended almost another half tile, if the ship is off, or with 1 electricity hit.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Grapple Teleport X-Ray Climb
note: Exit the previous room with Samus in a standing pose (while grappled).
After teleporting, press right to release Grapple while staying standing (not being forced into a crouch).
Then X-ray climb to get up to the door transition, without needing to open the door.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 2 screens, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: Leave with Runway
strats.note: Run must be synched with the low tide.

strats.name: X-Mode and Space Jump, Leave with Shinespark
devNote: Two thorn hits are expected per attempt (with any additional leniency hits being multiplied by this amount).
FIXME: There is likely a fast wall jump climb strat with more spark frames.

strats.name: Walljump
note: Jump across the first platforms. It is fine to jump from them when they are a bit submerged.
Get a bit of run speed on the final platform, and wall jump if necessary.
When accidentally falling off the platforms, it may be best to take a spike hit and climb the left wall.

strats.name: Wrecked Ship E-Tank Platforming
note: Jump onto the first platform, which is easiest when the water is low.
Continue jumping on the platforms to prevent them from going into the water.
Get a bit of run speed on the final platform, which is easiest while the water is low, then jump to the solid ground.

strats.name: Wrecked Ship E-Tank Spring Ball Bounce
note: From a standstill at the door, jump just before the first step.
Do a lateral mid-air morph and bounce on the first platform.
This should bounce on the third platform and get to the item.

strats.name: Come In Shinecharged (Power Off)
note: Jump as far as possible before activating the spark, while sparking high enough to crash into the Chozo statue's hand.
devNote: If power is on, then this strat may not quite work because the water can interfere with the runway for the jump.
But in that case, platforming is possible as a relatively free alternative.

strats.name: Come In Shinecharging (Power Off)
note: Gain a shinecharge while entering the room.
Run back to the door, and then run left and jump as far as possible before activating the spark, while sparking high enough to crash into the Chozo statue's hand.
devNote: If power is on, then this strat may not quite work because the water can interfere with the runway.
But in that case, platforming is possible as a relatively free alternative.

strats.name: Precise Grapple
note: Fling Samus from the first set of grapple blocks to the second set without falling. Requires precise timing.
It can help to perform a lateral mid-air morph and unmorph.

strats.name: Phantoon is Alive Wall Jump
strats.note: From the top right platform, jump to the left into the thorns, then climb the left wall.
strats.devNote: The canCarefulJump and Gravity are here, as with either of those, there is access across with or without f_DefeatedPhantoon.

strats.name: Phantoon is Alive Speed Walljump
note: Run from the adjacent room and jump at the end of the platform.
From the top right platform, jump to the left and wall jump just above the spikes and climb the left wall.
strats.devNote: Because this requires canCarefulJump, there is no canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess as there is a path across with or without f_DefeatedPhantoon.

strats.name: Phantoon is Alive, IBJ From Spikes
strats.note: In the spike pit, near the left wall, jump into an IBJ to climb out.
strats.devNote: The h_IBJFromThorns requires canCarefulJump. There is no loss of access, because with that it is possible to get across with or without f_DefeatedPhantoon.

strats.name: Phantoon is Alive, HiJump Spring Ball Jump
Grapple Teleport
strats.note: After teleporting, press down to retract Grapple, to prevent getting stuck inside the Chozo statue.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport Inside Wall
note: After teleporting, Samus should be standing inside the wall.
Retract Grapple by pressing up, which will pull Samus down and right.
Turn around to the left, then hold right, and release Grapple while still holding right.
Perform a turn-around spin jump (to the left).
Then morph and roll out to the right.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport X-Ray Climb
note: Exit the previous room with Samus in a standing pose (while grappled).
After teleporting, press right to release Grapple while staying standing (not being forced into a crouch).
Then X-ray climb to get on top of the Chozo statue.

strats.name: Precise Grapple
strats.note: Fling Samus from the first set of grapple blocks to the second set without falling. Requires precise timing.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Ceiling Bomb Jump
strats.note: Touch the item while remaining in artificial morph. Ceiling bomb jump back to the right, then use x-ray to cancel g-mode and obtain the item.
strats.devNote: This strat alone would only require canBePatient, but it is only possible after Ceiling Bomb Jumping there, so it would be a combined 4 minutes.

strats.name: Leave with Runway
strats.note: The conveyor will push Samus towards the door reducing the effective runway length.
strats.devNote: FIXME: Represent coming in and using the conveyor for more effective runway.

strats.name: Crystal Flash
strats.devNote: The Workrobot projectiles aren't a problem.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Covern
strats.note: Stand half way between the ledge and the save station to position the Covern and extend the runway as far as possible.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Covern
